name: M3u8 Downloader
tagline: Save M3u8 videos instantly for offline viewing.
description:
M3u8 Downloader turns tricky HLS playlists into simple MP4 files. Paste a manifest URL or let the extension auto-detect streams on the page, pick the quality you want, and it will download every segment, forward the right headers, and merge the video in the background without command-line tools.

It supports master playlists, CMAF/fMP4 segments, and multi-bitrate variants, retries failed chunks automatically, and runs in Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Brave, or Opera while keeping your browser responsive. The result is a source-quality MP4 you can archive, edit, or review offline.
seo_description: Download M3u8 videos easily for offline viewing. Fast, reliable M3u8 video downloader with high-quality downloads.
features: Detects HLS (m3u8) streams on any page or accepts direct playlist URLs
Parses master playlists to list every quality variant with bitrate and codec info
Forwards cookies, headers, and tokens automatically for authenticated streams
Downloads TS, CMAF, and fMP4 segments with auto-retries for stability
Merges segments into MP4 in the background without re-encoding
Queue manager processes multiple playlists sequentially with cancel support
Supports Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Brave, and Opera across desktop platforms
Stores licence data locally with no analytics or remote tracking

faqs.question: How do I download an m3u8 stream with this extension?
faqs.answer: Paste the playlist URL into the popup or enable auto-detect on the page, select the quality variant you want, and start the conversion. The MP4 will save when segment merging completes.

faqs.question: Does it work with authenticated streams?
faqs.answer: Yes. The downloader forwards cookies, referrers, and custom headers from your browser session so authorised streams play without manual configuration.

faqs.question: Can I queue multiple playlists?
faqs.answer: You can add several manifests to the queue and the extension will process them sequentially, keeping your browser responsive while conversions run.

faqs.question: Which browsers are supported?
faqs.answer: Builds ship for Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Brave, and Opera on Windows, macOS, and Linux. Safari is not supported.

faqs.question: Will it download DRM-protected or encrypted streams?
faqs.answer: No. The tool works with unencrypted HLS playlists only. DRM-protected streams remain inaccessible.

faqs.question: Do subtitles or alternate audio tracks download?
faqs.answer: The downloader captures the selected video/audio rendition. Subtitles or alternate audio tracks are not extracted; download them separately if required.

faqs.question: Is my data private?
faqs.answer: All detection, downloading, and merging happen locally. Only licence verification touches external servers, and no analytics are collected.

permission_justifications.justification:
Writes the final MP4 file to your downloads folder and keeps the queue status
accurate for each playlist.

Stores licence activation, preferred quality, and retry settings locally so the
downloader stays configured between sessions.

Detects when an HLS stream is available on the current tab and captures the playlist
URL automatically.

Allows queued conversions to continue while you switch tabs and restores the
progress view when you return.

Injects lightweight scripts to locate manifest URLs, parse variants, and gather
necessary headers.

Sends completion or error alerts so you know when conversions finish without
monitoring the popup.

Adds a “Detect M3U8 Stream” right-click option for quickly capturing manifests
from any page.

Merges HLS segments into MP4 files in the background, preventing the browser
UI from freezing during long downloads.

Grants access to sites serving HLS content so the extension can fetch segments
and associated playlists directly from those hosts.
